heisig_chinese_memo: Venom starts to choke on a spoon. He's about to get it out, when you manage to stop the spoon from getting out, so he turns purple, as he chokes, and dies.
heisig_constituent: purple, Prince, this here, stop, footprint, spoon, sitting on the ground, thread, spiderman
koohiiStory1: Stop sitting for so long - or else you'll get those purple threads (veins) on your legs from bad circulation. [link purple with those huge purple, bulging, crawling, worm-like varicose veins .....].
koohiiStory2: Why is your ass purple? Well, I stopped and sat for a bit on a pile of thread... (I guess it was freshly dyed).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You stop a spoon from moving by tying it with thread that's purple. The spoon wouldn't stop moving around, so you had to use your favorite purple thread to make it stop. It's the strongest thread you have.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine tying this spoon down with thread that's a color other than purple. Ah, the thread snaps. Darn, you better use your extra strong purple thread (the best color for strength!).
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have to use all of your purple thread, and now you need more. You go into the back yard and call over your purple sheep (し).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Oh, did you think purple things were made with dye? No no, purple is a special color. You have to find unique purple sheep to make purple thread and clothes.
Ru_AutoNotes:
Лиловый, сиреневый, пурпурный. Сравни: 菫色すみれいろ фиолетовый (фиалковый).

Реже — травы из рода Воробейник (ムラサキ); сейчас обычно пишутся каной. Растут группами, за что и получили название 群（むら）+咲き. Сиреневый цвет получил название по сиреневому красителю, который делался из их корней. Эгонихон пурпурно-голубой, заглавный представитель рода Воробейник в Японии.
Ru_Radicals: 匕 (ложка), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 止 (останавливать), 糸 (нить)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: this (此) thread (糸) is purple

humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze, bamboo and silk text, and Xiaozhuan from "糸", " this " sound. Bronze inscriptions and bamboo slips are written as "紪", silk script and small seal are changed into upper and lower structures, and written as " purple ". The original meaning is a mixture of red and blue. "Said Wen": "Purple, silk, green and red." "The Analects. "Yanghuo": "Zi said: "The evil purple is the one who wins the Zhu."" Zheng Xuan's note: "Kong said: Zhu, the true color; purple, the good one." The idiom "Red and purple wins Zhu" or "Red and purple chaos Zhu" For this reason, the metaphor is to use evil to seize righteousness and chaos from below. Also refers to purple clothes or cloth. "Han Fei. "The Foreign Reserve said upper left": "Qi Huan is good at dressing purple, and a country can dress purple." It means that Qi Huangong loves to wear purple clothes, so the whole country wears purple clothes. "The Book of Later Han Dynasty. "Feng Yanzhuan": "Bringing gold and hanging purple." Li Xian's note: "Gold is a seal, and purple is a silk ribbon." " Sou " is a silk ribbon. Only the princes of the Han Dynasty can wear purple ribbons; they wear official seals and tie The purple ribbon is a metaphor for prominent status.

The inscriptions on the inscriptions are incomplete, suspected to be used as the original meaning. Caihou Canzhong: "Ziwei".

Bamboo slips are used as the original meaning, "Baoshan Chujian. Jian Ce" Jian 259: "A purple hat of Wei." " Wei " means leather processed by removing hair; it refers to a purple leather hat. "Xinyang Chu Bamboo Slips" 2 set 6: "The curtain of purple 緅." "緅" is the color of black with red; it means the two-color tent of purple 緅.

Silk book is used as the original meaning, "Mawangdui Silk Book. Line 212 of the Book of Strategists in the Warring States Period: "Qi Zi is also a ruin, and Jia (price) is ten times." This sentence refers to Qi's preference for purple. Some people dyed it purple with inferior plain cloth and made ten times the profit. . The silk book also uses "茈" as " purple ", "Mawangdui silk book. "Health Prescription" Line 162: "Boil Liao (Zi) Wei with juice." "Zi Wei" means "Bigweed", which is the alias of "Lingxiaohua" and is a Chinese herbal medicine.

In ancient China, purple was used to represent dignity. In Eastern Han Dynasty Liu Xiang’s "Legend of the Immortals": "Lao Tzu Journey to the West, Guan Ling Yin was happy to see the purple air floating pass, and Lao Tzu also passed by the green ox." According to legend, Lao Tzu passed the Hangu Pass. Ling Yin of Guguan saw the purple qi coming from the east, and knew that there would be a saint to pass, and she saw Laozi riding a green bull. This is the source of the idiom "Purple Qi from the East", which is a metaphor for auspicious signs. The Forbidden City in Beijing is also known as the "Forbidden City." In the West, purple also represents nobleness, because in ancient Rome only nobles wore purple clothes. Since ancient times, purple has a special meaning in religion. The "Bible" records that in the Old Testament, the Israelites' tabernacle and priests' robes were purple. Until now, the robes and dresses of Catholic bishops are still mainly purple.

humanum_full_description:
金文、簡帛文字、小篆從「糸」，「此」聲。金文、竹簡寫作「紪」，帛書、小篆改為上下結構，寫作「紫」。本義是紅色和藍色混合的一種顏色。《說文》：「紫，帛青赤色。」《論語．陽貨》：「子曰：『惡紫之奪朱也。』」鄭玄注：「孔曰：朱，正色；紫，間色之好者。」成語「紅紫奪朱」或「紅紫亂朱」出於此，比喻以邪奪正、以下亂上。又指紫色的衣服或布帛。《韓非子．外儲說左上》：「齊桓公好服紫，一國盡服紫。」意指齊桓公愛穿紫色的衣服，於是全國都穿紫色的衣服。《後漢書．馮衍傳》：「懷金垂紫。」李賢注：「金謂印也，紫謂綬也。」「綬」是一種絲質的帶子，漢代只有公侯才會繫上紫綬；佩帶官印和繫着紫色的帶子，比喻地位顯赫。

　　金文辭殘，疑用作本義。蔡侯殘鐘：「紫維」。

　　竹簡用作本義，《包山楚簡．遣策》簡259：「一紫韋之帽。」「韋」即去毛加工而成的皮革；指一頂紫色的皮帽。《信陽楚簡》2組簡6：「紫緅之幕。」「緅」是黑中帶紅的顏色；意指紫緅兩色的帳幕。

　　帛書用作本義，《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第212行：「齊紫，敗素也，而賈（價）十倍。」這句指齊國愛好紫色，有人用劣質的素色布帛染成紫色，結果獲利十倍。帛書又以「茈」為「紫」，《馬王堆帛書．養生方》第162行：「以汁煮茈（紫）威。」「紫威」即「紫葳」，是「凌霄花」的別名，是一種中草藥。

　　中國古代以紫色代表尊貴，東漢劉向《列仙傳》：「老子西游，關令尹喜望見有紫氣浮關，而老子果乘青牛而過也。」傳說老子過函谷關前，函谷關的令尹見到有紫氣從東邊而來，知道將有聖人過關，果然見老子騎着青牛而來。這是成語「紫氣東來」的出處，比喻吉祥的徵兆。北京故宮又稱為「紫禁城」。在西方，紫色亦代表尊貴，因為古羅馬只有貴族穿着紫色的衣服。而自古以來，紫色在宗教中有特別的意義。《聖經》記載舊約時代以色列人的會幕和祭司的袍子都是紫色的。直到現在，天主教的主教的長袍和禮服仍以紫色為主。

紫字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　紫； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页919第29
【廣韻】將此切【集韻】蔣氏切，?音呰。【說文】帛靑赤色。【釋名】紫，疵也，非正色。五色之疵瑕，以惑人者也。【論語】紅紫不以爲褻服。【郉昺疏】紫，北方閒色。【又】惡紫之奪朱也。【何晏註】紫，閒色之好者。　又水名。【史記·司馬相如傳】紫淵在其北。【註】文穎曰：西河穀羅縣有紫澤，其水紫色。　又姓。【廣韻】出《何氏姓苑》。　又同孳。【荀子·非十二子篇】紫然洞然。【註】紫，與孳同。柔弱之貌。

考證：〔【釋名】紫，疵也，非正色。正色之疵瑕，以惑人者也。〕　謹照原文正色之疵改五色之疵。〔又同絮。【荀子·非十二子篇】紫然洞然。【註】紫，與絮同。〕　謹照原文兩絮字?改孳。

Meaning Mnemonic
You stop a spoon from moving by tying it with thread that's purple. The spoon wouldn't stop moving around, so you had to use your favorite purple thread to make it stop. It's the strongest thread you have.
Imagine tying this spoon down with thread that's a color other than purple. Ah, the thread snaps. Darn, you better use your extra strong purple thread (the best color for strength!).
Reading Mnemonic
You have to use all of your purple thread, and now you need more. You go into the back yard and call over your purple sheep (し).
Oh, did you think purple things were made with dye? No no, purple is a special color. You have to find unique purple sheep to make purple thread and clothes.
